N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6500.10 - Award limitations

State Regulations
(a) No awards shall be made to an institution
of higher education within the State for the purposes of recruiting a faculty
member from another institution of higher education within the State unless the
applying institution can demonstrate to NYSTAR's satisfaction, in its sole
discretion, that such recruitment is in the best interests of the

State. (b) No award recipient who
received an award for either recruitment or retention may apply for an award
for retention of the same faculty member within three years of the termination
of the prior award
(c) No State
assistance payments awarded by NYSTAR, or any other state funds made available
by another State agency or State public authority, may be included as part of
the applicant's match. The executive director, in his/her sole discretion, may
waive this prohibition upon a finding of good cause. Nothing in the subdivision
prohibits the State University of New York or the City University of New York
from using a portion of their respective operating funds as match. (d) NYSTAR, in its sole discretion, may
terminate contracts which do not adhere to the timelines established in the
contract. (e) The term of the
employment agreement between the award recipient and the recruited and/or
retained faculty member shall be at a minimum for a period coextensive with the
term of the award unless NYSTAR, for good cause shown, determines that it may
be of a shorter duration. Notes
